newsitem.title: UK: Immediate Entertainment plans AIM float in Autumn.
newsitem.headline: Immediate Entertainment plans AIM float in Autumn.

text.p: Independent record company Immediate Entertainment Group Inc said on Wednesday it would not seek to float on the London Stock Exchange's Alternative Investment Market (AIM) until the autumn of 1997.
Immediate president Tony Calder said the company was preoccupied with finalising plans for an August listing on NASDAQ and was in talks with another UK company about an acquisition.
"There is simply not enough hours in the day at the moment," Calder said in reference to the possibility of an imminent AIM listing.
Calder set up Immediate Records in 1965 in partnership with former Rolling Stones manager Andrew Loog Oldham.
Since then, the company has developed into an integrated record company with studios, CD plant and in-house marketing, sales and distribution systems.

Shares in Immediate began trading on the OTC bulletin board in the United States in October 1996 and are expected to start trading on the German OTC markets in Frankfurt and Berlin on September 1 this year.
